page.title: 10Wildlife in Lawshall Area.
page.content: The wildlife in this area is very good. There is a herd of roe deer roaming from Frithy Wood to Chadacre Wood. Countless colonies of bats, plenty of foxes,inspite of the local hunt! Rabbits,hares,grey squirrels,hedgehogs, stoats,weasels,rats,mice,voles,shrews. Plenty of butterflies, most common are: Red Admiral,Peacock,Small Tortoiseshell Large Whites and Orange Tips. Moths, dragonflies,damselflies, plenty of pond life, water voles, excellent frog,toad and newt breading grounds. There is a local pond well stocked for fishing, with carp(mirror,crusian,common,and golden) rudd, roach, tench, although the farmer who owns it, specifies that it is for village residents use only, and all fish must be returned to the pond.Bird spotting too, is very reward- ing in this area. On a recent survey, 80 different species were recorded.
